info.title: DICOM and SNOMED Implementation of Codes for Orthodontic/Craniofacial 2D Photographic Views

article.para: Appendix 5 has illustrations for encoding orthodontic/craniofacial views using DICOM with SNOMED CT terminology. If needed, more SNOMED CT codes can be retrieved from the Unified Medical Language Systems Metathesaurus browser on the US National Library of Medicine website (https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/index.html).

listitem.para: Appendix 5.1 Summary of DICOM tags for orthodontic/craniofacial views — The table below contains all DICOM tags used to uniquely identify and encode each orthodontic view.

Appendix 5.2 List of codes used in the DICOM CP1571 view set — Codes used in the view set illustrated in DICOM correction package #1571, called "Add Orthodontics and Forensic Odontology View Sets to Structured Display."

Appendix 5.3 List of codes used for specific Extraoral Views — Codes for the drawings shown in Figure 3; the user can customize view sets by selecting the desired views and the applicable SNOMED CT codes.

Appendix 5.4 List of codes used for specific Intraoral Views — Codes for the drawings shown in Figure 3; the user can customize view sets by selecting the desired views and the applicable SNOMED CT codes.

Appendix 5.9 Primary Anatomic Structure Sequence (0008,2228) — Primary Anatomic Structure Sequence contains a list of visible teeth using ISO tooth numbering system (represented as SNOMED CT codes) in a specific view.

para.link: Appendix 5.12 Functional Condition Present During Acquisition

section.title: Summary of DICOM tags for orthodontic/craniofacial views
section.para: It was compiled from the various DICOM CID (Content IDs) tables. Only the domain relevant values of each table are included here.The table below contains all DICOM tags used to uniquely identify and encode each orthodontic view.
It was compiled from the various DICOM CID (Content IDs) tables. Only the domain relevant values of each table are included here.

td.para: "Mandible partly open, mouth partly open" SCT: 789130005

para.emphasis: The subcategories of this SNOMED code are of limited interest for the orthodontic domain, however they may be used within a Primary Anatomic Structure Modifier Sequence (0008,2230).

section.title: List of codes used in the DICOM CP1571 view set
section.para: Codes used in the view set illustrated in DICOM correction package #1571, called "Add Orthodontics and Forensic Odontology View Sets to Structured Display."

td.para: EO.RP.LR.CO Right profile, lips relaxed, centric occlusion
EO.FF.LR.CO Full face, lips relaxed, centric occlusion
EO.FF.FS.CO Full face, full smile, centric occlusion
Example: Patient in permanent dentition may show the following teeth in this view
IO.MX.MO.OV.WM Intraoral, maxillary, mouth open, occlusal view, with mirror (corrected)
Example: Patient in mixed dentition may show the following teeth in this view
Text box (eg: Patient's Initials, Patient's age in years-months, Date photographs taken, etc.)
IO.MD.MO.OV.WM Intraoral mandible, occlusal view, mouth open, with mirror (corrected)
Example: Patient in mixed dentition may show the following teeth in this view
IO.RB.CO Intraoral, right buccal segment, centric occlusion
Example: Patient in permanent dentition may show the following teeth in this view
IO.FV.CO Intraoral, frontal view, centric occlusion
Example: Patient in primary dentition may show the following teeth in this view
IO.LB.CO Intraoral, left buccal segment, centric occlusion
Example: Patient in permanent dentition may show the following teeth in this view

section.title: Image Laterality (0020,0062)
section.para:
Laterality of (possibly paired) body part (as described in Anatomic Region Sequence (0008,2218)) examined.
Shall be consistent with any laterality information contained in Primary Anatomic Structure Modifier Sequence (0008,2230). DICOM PS 3.3 Section 10.5 General Anatomy Macros discusses the relationship between Image Laterality (0020,0062) and Primary Anatomic Structure Modifier Sequence (0008,2230):
"Laterality is often encoded in a separate Attribute, Image Laterality (0020,0062) or Frame Laterality (0020,9072), rather than in Anatomic Region Modifier Sequence (0008,2220) or Primary Anatomic Structure Modifier Sequence (0008,2230)." This means that even thought the Laterality should be encoded in the Anatomic Region Modifier Sequence, it is often encoded in Image Laterality. Since these two shall be consistent, DICOM provides a mapping between the two (see below, one is an enumerated value as CS the other a code sequence).
The section references Part 16 Table L-5, a table which relates a specific anatomic region is to be considered a paired structure or not. Below, we report a table of those body parts relevant to orthodontic visible light images
Laterality (0020,0060) (a Series level Attribute) must be absent, because
this series could contain images of different Laterality and
because Laterality (0020,0060) only allows 'L' and 'R' enumerated values, which are not sufficient to describe these images.

(excerpt from DICOM Part 16 Table L-5 with orthodontic domain relevant regions)

The SNOMED codes from the above table might not match the ones on the rest of this document.
The above table was copies from the DICOM standard. However, the recommendation for usage of SNOMED CT codes is to always use the most granular code possible for what the code is describing. The implementer shall follow the codes as defined in this document.

td.para: Only use if this Series is of Mastoid bone, Maxilla or Temporomandibular joint. For all other anatomic regions containing one or both sides, set to 'U'.
Only use if this Series is of Mastoid bone, Maxilla or Temporomandibular joint. For all other anatomic regions containing one or both sides, set to 'U'.
Only use if this Series is of Mastoid bone, Maxilla or Temporomandibular joint. For all other anatomic regions containing one or both sides, set to 'U'. This is almost never used.

For example, a frontal face smiling photograph, would have Image Laterality of 'U'. However, an image which would contain both the left Maxilla and the right Maxilla in the same frame (image) (for example making use of mirrors or by merging two images into one) would have an Image Laterality of 'B'.

section.title: Patient Orientation (0020,0020)
section.para: Patient direction of the rows and columns of the image. Required because:

listitem.para: This IOD VL Photographic Image does not require Image Orientation (Patient) (0020,0037) or Image Position (Patient) (0020,0032)
This IOD VL Photographic Image does not require Image Orientation (Slide) (0048,0102).

section.para: Patient Orientation (0020,0020) relative to the image plane shall be specified by two values that designate the anatomical direction of the positive row axis (left to right) and the positive column axis (top to bottom).

listitem.para: The first entry is the direction of the rows, given by the direction of the last pixel in the first row from the first pixel in that row.
The second entry is the direction of the columns, given by the direction of the last pixel in the first column from the first pixel in that column.

section.para: Since Anatomical Orientation Type (0010,2210) is absent (or has a value of BIPED), anatomical direction shall be designated by abbreviations using the capital letters:
Example: a Right Profile photograph of the face, would have Patient Orientation set to ['A','F']

section.title: Primary Anatomic Structure Sequence (0008,2228)
section.para: Primary Anatomic Structure Sequence contains a list of visible teeth using ISO tooth numbering system (represented as SNOMED CT codes) in a specific view.

listitem.para: When no teeth are visible, this sequence will be Null.
When one tooth is visible, this sequence will contain a single SNOMED CT code representing the visible tooth.
When more teeth are visible, this sequence will contain a list of SNOMED CT codes representing all visible teeth.
When patient appears to be edentulous

section.para: Refer to Table below for a list of permissible values.

td.para: if in the view, one expects to see teeth but sees none. The subcategories of this SNOMED code are of limited interest for the orthodontic domain, however they may be used within a Primary Anatomic Structure Modifier Sequence (0008,2230).

section.title: Progress
section.para: During an orthodontic treatment, it is common for the provider to keep track of treatment progress by regularly collecting records (such as photographs or intra-oral surface scans) [provide reference]. It is therefore useful to identify when, relative to an orthodontic treatment, the records were taken. Examples could be:

td.para: Records taken before treatment was begun.
Records taken the moment treatment was begun.
Records taken the moment treatment was completed.
Records taken after treatment was completed.

section.para: Where n is a serial number or letter indicating the sequence order. For example, "Pre-treatment 1" would refer to records taken temporally before "Pre-treatment 3". And the existence of "Pre-treatment 3" indicates that other two sets of records where take for this patient.

section.title: Proposed DICOM tags to keep record of progress
Study Description (0008,1030)
section.para: This is an optional DICOM tag, which can contain a Long String (64 character max), part of the General Study module. Because each orthodontic visit would fall under a DICOM Study, this location could be appropriate.

listitem.para: Study Description is often visible from many PACS search results. The provider can therefore quickly identify which progress the entry refers to. This is a weak pro, because nothing prevents orthodontic specific software to show this information, were it stored elsewhere.
Text limited to 64 characters. Taking up ca 16 characters for progress, would leave only 48 characters for other study descriptions.
Cannot be coded. Study Description does not allow code sets and could contain other data, as implementation might vary.

section.title: Reason For Performed Procedure Code Sequence Attribute (0040,1012)

para.emphasis: This is an optional DICOM tag, which can contain a Long String (64 character max), part of the General Study module. Because each orthodontic visit would fall under a DICOM Study, this location could be appropriate.

listitem.para: This is a code sequence, hence SNOMED CT codes could be used here.
This attribute allow for multiple instances codes. This means that using one to indicate progress, would not limit the provider for adding others.

Existing PACS software does not look at this tag, and would not show it by default. This is a weak con, because nothing prevents orthodontic specific software to show these fields. Actually, this could be an incentive for vendors to develop more orthodontic specific DICOM software, and for orthodontic providers to support and request them.
